block.p: NASCAR--Fined Peter Sospenzo, crew chief, $25,000 for rules violations in Jeremy Mayfield's victory Sunday at California Speedway.
NASCAR--Fined Peter Sospenzo, crew chief, $25,000 for rules violations in Jeremy Mayfield's victory Sunday at California Speedway.

American League BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Activated RHP Scott Erickson from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned RHP Gabe Molina to Rochester of the International League. MINNESOTA TWINS--Purchased the contract of INF Jay Canizaro from Salt Lake of the PCL. Optioned 2B Todd Walker to Salt Lake. Designated INF Cleatus Davidson from New Britain of the Eastern League for assignment. TAMPA BAY DEVIL RAYS--Optioned RHP Ryan Rupe to Durham of the International League. Recalled RHP Cory Lidle from Durham. TEXAS RANGERS--Placed OF Gabe Kapler on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled INF Kelly Dransfeldt from Oklahoma of the PCL.
National League ST. LOUIS CARDINALS--Signed RHP Darren Holmes.

National Football League CINCINNATI BENGALS--Waived CB Ric Mathias with an injury settlement. DALLAS COWBOYS--Agreed to terms with LB Barron Wortham. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Waived T Ron Manuel, LB Jermaine L. Smith and S Gana Joseph. HOUSTON--Named Larry Bryan, Joel Patten and Dave Sears college scouts; Rob Kisiel pro scouting assistant, and Jamaal Stephenson college scouting assistant. KANSAS CITY CHIEFS--Agreed to terms with G Brenden Stai and G Jeff Blackshear. NEW ENGLAND PATRIOTS--Signed LB Barrin Simpson. Released QB Brian Kuklick and CB Robbie Duncan. PITTSBURGH STEELERS--Named Bill Baker college scouting coordinator. Promoted Phil Kreidler from college scout to pro scout. ST. LOUIS RAMS--Signed T Benny Anderson and WR Damien Dodson.
National Hockey League COLUMBUS BLUE JACKETS--Signed G Greg Gardner. MINNESOTA WILD--Signed F Steve Aronson. TORONTO MAPLE LEAFS--Signed C Jonathan Gagnon to a three-year contract.
Major League Soccer COLUMBUS CREW--Announced the retirement of MF Rob Smith.

MAAC--Named Barbara Church senior associate commissioner, John Leonard assistant commissioner, and Ken Taylor director of special events and ice hockey. CLEMSON--Signed Jim Davis, women's basketball coach, to a five-year contract. CONCORDIA, ST. PAUL--Named Scott Zachmann men's and women's soccer coach. DAYTON--Signed Jaci Clark, women's basketball coach, to a two-year contract extension, through 2004. HOWARD--Named Frankie Allen men's basketball coach. IOWA--Named Michael Morgan women's assistant basketball coach. NEW ENGLAND COLLEGE--Named Kari Hunt women's basketball coach. NEW MEXICO--Named Travis Lyons men's assistant basketball coach. PATTEN--Announced the resignations of Dave Weber, director of athletics and men's basketball coach, Mychael Heuer, women's basketball coach, and Monica Heuer, women's associate basketball coach. WEST ALABAMA--Announced the resignation of Mark Smartt, baseball coach, effective May 31.
